00030 /// Thread class.
00031 /// This class that encapsulates a platform-specific thread facility.
00032 /// @class Thread
00033 
00034 /// Identification of this source file in the Log file. 
00035 /// @private @memberof Thread
00036 static cchar sourceID[] = "ZTH";
00037 
00038 // ---------------------
00039 /// @cond hides_from_doxygen (it gets confused)
00040 
00041 /// The operating-system handle of a Thread
00042 IF_LINUX(typedef pthread_t hthread;)
00043 IF_WINDOWS(typedef HANDLE hthread;)
00044 
00045 /// The unique sequential number of a Thread
00046 IF_LINUX(__thread uint currentThreadSeqNo);
00047 IF_WINDOWS(__declspec(thread) uint currentThreadSeqNo);
00048 
00049 /// @endcond
00050 // ---------------------
00051 
00052 /// Structure passed as parameter for a Thread.
00053 /// This structure is used internally by the framework when creating an
00054 /// application Thread.
00055 /// @private @memberof Thread
00056 typedef struct
00057 {
00058    ThreadFunc threadFunc; ///< @private Thread funtion
00059    void* parm;            ///< @private parameter for the Thread function
00060 } ThreadParm;
00061 
00062 /// Next unique sequential Thread number
00063 /// @private @memberof Thread
00064 static uint currentSeqNo;  
00065 
00066 /// Contention mutex for Thread-aware printf substitute
00067 /// @private @memberof Thread
00068 static mutex_t* printfMutex;
00069 
00070 // prototypes
00071 /// @cond hides_from_doxygen
00072 static void createThread(ThreadFunc, void*);
00073 static threadfunc proxyThreadFunc(void*);
00074 /// @endcond
00075 
00076 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00077 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00078 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00079 
00080 /** Starts n instances of a Thread.
00081 
00082     @param
00083     n : the number of instances of a Thread to instantiate
00084 
00085     @param
00086     threadFunc : the main Thread function of the @link Thread Threads @endlink
00087     being instantiated
00088 
00089     @param
00090     parm : the parameter passes to the main Thread function
00091     being instantiated
00092 
00093     @memberof Thread
00094 */
00095 
00096 TC2API void thread_addThreads(uint n, ThreadFunc threadFunc, void* parm)
00097 {
00098    uint i;
00099 
00100    log_func(thread_addThreads);
00101    log_finfo("adding %d threads", n);
00102 
00103    if (n == 0)
00104       log_fwarn("strange, adding 0 threads here...");
00105 
00106    for (i = 0; i < n; i++)
00107    {
00108       ThreadParm* threadParm = (ThreadParm*)calloc(1, sizeof(ThreadParm));
00109       assert(threadParm);
00110 
00111       threadParm->threadFunc = threadFunc;
00112       threadParm->parm = parm;
00113 
00114       // platform-specific creation of a thread running the proxy function
00115       log_finfo("creating a thread");
00116       createThread(proxyThreadFunc, threadParm);
00117    }
00118 }
00119 
00120 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00121 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00122 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00123 
00124 /** Thread class initialization.
00125 
00126     @memberof Thread
00127 */
00128 
00129 TC2API void thread_init(void)
00130 {
00131    log_func(thread_init);
00132    log_finfo("Thread class inicialization");
00133 
00134    log_finfo("creating the printf contention mutex");
00135    printfMutex = mutex_create();
00136 }
00137 
00138 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00139 // PUBLIC INTERFACE
00140 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00141 
00142 /** Thread-safe printf substitute.
00143 
00144     @memberof Thread
00145 */
00146 
00147 TC2API void thread_printf(const char* format, ...)
00148 {
00149    va_list parms;
00150    va_start(parms,format);
00151 
00152    assert(format);
00153 
00154    mutex_lock(printfMutex);
00155    vprintf(format, parms);
00156    fflush(stdout);
00157    mutex_unlock(printfMutex);
00158 }

00164 /** The chronological activation number of the running Thread
00165 
00166     @return
00167     chronological activation number of the running Thread
00168 
00169     @memberof Thread
00170 */
00171 
00172 TC2API uint thread_selfSeqNo(void)
00173 {
00174    return currentThreadSeqNo;
00175 }

00177 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00178 // INTERNAL HELPER FUNCTIONS
00179 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00180 
00181 /** Operating-system-level function that creates and runs a new Thread.
00182     @fn void createThread(ThreadFunc threadFunc, void* arg)
00183 
00184     @param [in]
00185     threadFunc : the Thread main function
00186 
00187     @param [in]
00188     arg : argument to the Thread main function
00189 
00190     @return
00191     identification of the Thread just created
00192 
00193     @private @memberof Thread
00194 */
00195 
00196 #if PLATFORM(Linux)
00197 static void createThread(ThreadFunc threadFunc, void* arg)
00198 {
00199    pthread_t tid;;
00200    int ret = pthread_create(
00201      &tid,        // thread id (result)
00202       NULL,       // default attributes
00203       threadFunc, // start routine
00204       arg         // arguments
00205       );
00206 
00207    assert(ret == 0);
00208 }
00209 #endif
00210 
00211 #if PLATFORM(Windows)
00212 static void createThread(ThreadFunc threadFunc, void* arg)
00213 {
00214 // HANDLE hThread = CreateThread(
00215    HANDLE hThread = (HANDLE)_beginthreadex(
00216       NULL,       // LPSECURITY_ATTRIBUTES
00217       0,          // stack size (0=default)
00218       threadFunc, // LPTHREAD_START_ROUTINE
00219       arg,        // arguments
00220       0,          // creation flags (0 = runs immediately)
00221       NULL        // thread id
00222       );
00223 
00224    assert(hThread);
00225 }  
00226 #endif
00227 
00228 // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00229 
00230 /** Auxiliary function used to start a new Thread.
00231 
00232     @param [in]
00233     _parm : parameter passed to the Thread main function
00234 
00235     @private @memberof Thread
00236 */
00237 
00238 static threadfunc proxyThreadFunc(void* _parm)
00239 {
00240    // the only reason for the existence of this function is to initialize the
00241    // thread-local-storage (TLS) variable currentThreadSeqNo, which provides
00242    // platform-independent way of identifying threads; it could be used to
00243    // provide other pre-activation thread initialization
00244 
00245    // parameter received by this proxy threadfunc
00246    ThreadParm* threadParm = (ThreadParm*)_parm;
00247 
00248    // this is the real threadfunc
00249    ThreadFunc threadFunc = threadParm->threadFunc;
00250 
00251    // this is the real parm
00252    void* parm = threadParm->parm;
00253 
00254    // call free ThreadParm now, doesn't need it anymore
00255    free(threadParm);
00256 
00257    currentThreadSeqNo = ++currentSeqNo;
00258 
00259    // finally, runs the user thread...
00260    return threadFunc(parm);
00261 }
